physical_appearance:This is a banner. It has a flat square top
 and hangs downwards
 with an angular shape at the bottom. The bottom hem is lined with loose threads. The banner features a large logo in the center
 topped with the shape of a bird with outstretched wings. Below the bird
 there are several lines of Chinese scripts.

sgcool_label_text:This banner belongs to part of a collection of artefacts owned by Chan Phui Kong who was involved in the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136.  Chan’s collection forms part of a larger collection of materials gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. \r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.\r\n

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a banner. It has a flat square top, and hangs downwards, with an angular shape at the bottom. The bottom hem is lined with loose threads. The banner features a large logo in the center, topped with the shape of a bird with outstretched wings. Below the bird, there are several lines of Chinese scripts.

metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This banner belongs to part of a collection of artefacts owned by Chan Phui Kong who was involved in the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136.  Chan’s collection forms part of a larger collection of materials gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya.
